alert.note: Alert for Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 27 at 1:50AM PDT until June 27 at 4:30PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Washington, including the following counties, Chelan and Okanogan. * WHEN...From 1 PM PDT this afternoon through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of creeks, streams, and other flood-prone locations like burn scars. Some of the burned areas included in the Flash Flood Watch are the Red Apple, 25 Mile, Cedar Creek, Cub Creek, and Muckamuck burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Atmospheric conditions will once again favor slow moving thunderstorms capable of locally heavy rain this afternoon and early this evening. Steep terrain and burned areas in Chelan and Okanogan counties will be particularly vulnerable to flash flooding. Runoff will be capable of producing rapid rises on creeks as well as producing rock and mud slides. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
